questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
A hospital uses Dynamics 365 Customer Engagement. The scheduling department schedules doctors for surgeries.
You need to configure relationships between doctor and patient records.
From the doctor entity, which relationship types should you use? To answer, drag the relationship types for the correct scenarios. Each relationship type may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: I vote for N:N for the second. A doctor could work on multiple operation rooms, and one operation room could be used by multiple doctors.
It says "a doctor" with "multiple patients". Therefore, the answer provided is correct.
1:N and N:N is correct
In the exam. Exactly the same. It is 1:N and N:N
in exam
1 :N , N:N
@SoMuchConfusion Incorrect. You need to reread the scenarios. Operating rooms and doctors = N:N. Many rooms with many doctors. A doctor and patients = 1:N. One doctor can have many patients.
in exam
correct

I think the answer provided is wrong. "You need to configure relationships between doctor and patient records." In the context of an operating room, you would typically have ONE patient and potentially multiple doctors. I believe the correct answer is 1:N for the first scenario and N:1 for the second.

comments.content:
1. 1:N - 1 Doctor, Many Patients
2. N:N - Many Operating Rooms, Many Doctors

discussion.content: hint: ratio single(1): single (1); multiple(N): (N)multiple; single(1): (N)multiple; multiple(N):(1)single

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service system administrator. You receive an email notification that you have reached 80 percent of your Dynamics 365 storage limit.
You perform the following actions to free up space:
✑ Delete known items that use large amount of storage.
✑ Perform bulk deletes on suspended system jobs.
✑ Delete audit logs older than six months old.
✑ Delete email attachments older than two years old.
The total storage used indicator shows that the storage amount has not changed after you perform the actions.
You need to determine why the storage amount has not changed.
What is the cause?

discussion.content: This came up twice in the exam

comments.content: The question is word to word the same as question 21 in topic 6

discussion.content:
The question it's slightly different from the previuos one, the correct answer is D.

please refer to this:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/sales-enterprise/troubleshooting
It's correct
again?

choices.D: Suspended workflows are in a waiting state, therefore cannot be deleted.
choices.A: The current audit log cannot be deleted.
choices.B: Email attachments can only be deleted when the associated email is deleted.
choices.C: The system can take up to 24 hours to update storage information.

questions.question_text:
Note: This question is part of a series of questions that present the same scenario. Each question in the series contains a unique solution that might meet the stated goals. Some question sets might have more than one correct solution, while others might not have a correct solution.
After you answer a question in this section, you will NOT be able to return to it. As a result, these questions will not appear in the review screen.
You are a Dynamics 365 for Sales administrator for a software company. The sales team need to attach a large number of supporting documents to customer records, but management does not want to incur the cost of additional storage.
The company does not have any Office 365 application integrations enabled.
You need to recommend a storage solution that keeps storage costs low.
Solution: Enable OneDrive for Business.
Does the solution meet the goal?

comments.content:
"Users with a SharePoint license can use OneDrive for Business. For SharePoint Online, Microsoft 365 subscriptions come with SharePoint Online."

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/power-platform/admin/enable-onedrive-for-business

discussion.content: "You need to recommend a storage solution that keeps storage costs low." I think only SP integration is the right answer. As far as i understand when u integrate OneDrive, u need to pay both

Here it seems to not talk about the steps to configure the integration, but about the solution to recommend. 
So you can recommend to enable onedrive, then when you implement it you will have to configure also SP
Explanation? It should be A

comments.content: they say it s in the same scenario and the previous question we said we enable side sync with sharepoint then .... i don't get

You can't enable OneDrive integration because SharePoint integration isn't enabled. You would have to enable SharePoint integration first and the question doesn't say anything about enabling SP integration.

discussion.content: Correct

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 for Customer Service developer.
You need to configure a new solution.
What should you configure for the new solution?

discussion.content: I think it should be B. Version here?
Installed Date and Security aren't options for a solution. Option value prefix is part of the publisher, not the solution. Version is configurable. Answer is B
I'll go with Version here

It's optional to configure the publisher, but NOT the version. So B is the correct answer:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/create-solution
The prefix is set in the publisher entity, so here it is version the good answer
we must to configure publisher first so D

comments.content: an existing publisher can be used when creating the solution, so it's B

discussion.content:
It's B 'Version'
in exam
As "version" is a mandatory field while creating a new solution, I would like to go with Option B.

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Customer Service system administrator.
You need to reduce the database size and reduce the rate at which the size of the audit log increases.
What should you do?

choices.D: Replicate the database to Microsoft Azure SQL.
choices.A: Back up the production instance and restore to a Sandbox instance. Delete the audit log.
choices.B: Turn auditing features off for entities or fields that are not needed.

discussion.content: correct

comments.content: the answer says delete current audit log, ...it is not advisable to delete current audit logs..so tturn off is the best answer

discussion.content: Correct
Correct.
correct
